intro: Sinogentiana souliei, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lanceolate leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Sinogentiana souliei is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
